text: So how do we get <@U687RKK0E> to fix the systems programming language problem? Do we need to kick up an illegal cloning lab? Because every year I stay in Julia it makes it harder and harder to switch out for other projects :joy:.

elements.text: to fix the systems programming language problem? Do we need to kick up an illegal cloning lab? Because every year I stay in Julia it makes it harder and harder to switch out for other projects

text: honestly, I'd be very happy for a C clone that added macros, strings that store their length (instead of null terminated) and an actual package system/no header files

elements.text: honestly, I'd be very happy for a C clone that added macros, strings that store their length (instead of null terminated) and an actual package system/no header files

text: also first class treatment of functions

elements.text: also first class treatment of functions

text: yeah, although C is basically there. I think Julia's approach of having every function have it's own type doesn't make as much sense for a systems level language. Making functions typed by input/output arguments is probably better there.

elements.text: yeah, although C is basically there. I think Julia's approach of having every function have it's own type doesn't make as much sense for a systems level language. Making functions typed by input/output arguments is probably better there.

text: "All" we need to do is add a separate compilation model, and a mode that requires everything to be concretely inferred, and we would pretty much be there. I hope to do this at some point.

elements.text: "All" we need to do is add a separate compilation model, and a mode that requires everything to be concretely inferred, and we would pretty much be there. I hope to do this at some point.

text: even if it was an "offshoot" of Julia I'd be 100% okay with that. But cloning lab is on the table.

text: If you're willing to have the compiled artifact itself be well-typed, it would potentially not break that much. But I don't really know for sure.
